p: To discuss the interaction details, compounds 8– 12 were placed in the second group due to the presence of the alkoxy group on the phenyl ring. Compound 8 is the most active compound (IC 50 = 2.15 ± 0.1 μM) in this group that shows hydrogen bonding with Glu233 and π–H interactions with Trp59 and Leu162, as shown in Figure 8 c.
